documents.title: massive container ship docks in uk
text: the biggest ship to dock in the uk has arrived in southampton .
the 400m-long mol triumph is the first of a new type of ultra-large container vessel to enter service this year .
its operators claim it is more fuel efficient than previous carriers .
built by samsung in south korea , the ship will run between chinese and european ports .
it can hold the equivalent of 20,170 containers .
southampton port operator said it was a `` significant and proud occasion '' .
author: Stephen Stafford
BBC South

documents.title: ex-councillor charged with wife 's murder
text: ex-councillor charged with wife 's murder

documents.title: deer trapped between buildings in abingdon
text: the rspca has released of a deer that got wedged among bags of rubbish between two buildings in abingdon last week .
the animal was spotted in the small gap in draymans walk by a member of the public on friday , spurring the charity into action .
animal collection officer grace mead said : `` the deer was trapped in a very small space between two brick walls next to a bin store .

`` we initially did n't think he was able to move or turn around to set himself free and thought we 'd have to remove the breeze blocks , but thankfully we were able to free him uninjured by coaxing him back out .
`` it was great to see him run off freely back to where he belongs . ''
the council is to now block up the gap to stop other animals getting trapped .

documents.title: wide angle lens needed for mol triumph
text: cameraman @ twitterid struggles to get largest ship ever to visit the uk into frame for @ twitterid

documents.title: breakingman jailed for oxford park rape
text: a man has been jailed for life after raping a woman in an oxford park .
mark pearton , 44 , of cavendish place , eastbourne , attacked the victim on the evening of 10 january as she was walking in harcourt hill .
he approached her from behind with a knife , threatened her with it , and led her to raleigh park where he raped her .
pearton was sentenced at oxford crown court earlier and told he would serve a minimum term of seven and a half years .

documents.title: nine-year-old killed by horse while riding with hunt
text: an inquest into the death of bonnie armitage has heard how the nine-year-old died when she was kicked in the chest by another horse .
bonnie
the horse was ridden by local farmer toti gifford , who suggested his horse may have been spooked by bonnie 's pony .
i was just cantering up the side of the field and my horse went 'irregular ' i heard a shout and looked back and saw bonnie .

documents.title: murder accused 'would n't harm a kid '
text: joseph eke , who denies killing two-year-old harry house , said the toddler called him `` daddy joe joe '' .

documents.title: pm 's campaign visit tests correspondent in southampton
text: theresa may visited the labour-held southampton test constituency this afternoon - causing a few issues for bbc south 's peter henley to contend with .
earlier this week , jeremy corbyn visited the constituency in support of labour candidate alan whitehead , who has held the seat since 1997 .
seems the `` important political visitor '' in southampton could be pm @ twitterid ! !
# electioncycle # canikeepup
meeting one , carefully selected , member of the electorate , perhaps ?
hearing there 's an `` important political visitor '' in southampton today so have put a tie on # electioncycle
she 's here ! !
but i am being told by no10 pr that @ twitterid `` wo n't be `` doing any regional media '' on visit to southampton # electioncycle
@ twitterid @ twitterid no tv debates , no regional media - she really thinks she 's too good for us mere plebs !
never has a cycling suit wearer looked more dashing : )
i thought it a tad w1a , but i 'll take the compliment , thank you !
you shoudl have spoken to her as a 'hard working person ' ! ! !
rather than media type # everyonehasavote
did the camera travel by car ?
so , i did try to interview the pm .
she got as far as `` hello peter '' before walking off .
# electioncycle # shortestinterviewever
did n't meet with alan whitehead and look at schools then ?
true , though tbf alan wo n't name the school where he said the parents were volunteering to clean loos
and you expect her to stop because it 's you , why ?
she came to southampton to show us why we should vote for her .
talking to the leading local political journalist might help us form a view .
of course , that may be what she 's afraid of .
afraid of a local political journalist ?
i do n't think so !
he should make an appointment not accost her in the street walking to her car
please withdraw the word accost - i simply said hello and asked if she had recieved a good welcome in southampton
ok
well she does n't really have any policies , so that 's about right .
on the plus side , it proves you are an ordinary member of the public .
nice tie though
did she look / sound strong or stable ?
what else would anyone need to ask her ?
she doesnt need to talk to anyone .
she 's strong and stable .
and strong and stable .
and strong and stable .
strong and stable .
really .
she is .
no-on is currently pm please correct yoyr headlines .
parliment has been dissolved
peter !
you 've lost the news ! !
at least she recognised you .
maybe she did n't like your tie ?
indeed and thank you for the almost unquestioning ppb for the tory party .
a labour ward with massive houses ?
thought you were a journalist ?
robotic at best !
looking at that report the pm came across as rude
hearing there 's an `` important political visitor '' in southampton today so have put a tie on # electioncycle
she 's here ! !
but i am being told by no10 pr that @ twitterid `` wo n't be `` doing any regional media '' on visit to southampton # electioncycle
@ twitterid @ twitterid no tv debates , no regional media - she really thinks she 's too good for us mere plebs !
if @ twitterid wo n't engage , stop giving her coverage .
compared to un-announced visit of # jeremycorbyn to york , garforth in yorkshire .
interesting to see they are not in the poorer areas of southampton
plums spoke defo richest area .
there 's a word for this it 's called `` hiding '' .
there 's another - cowardly
this control freakery is embarrassing & could be used as a plot in some dystopian novel .
cynical media control does n't always go to plan
i dare her to knock on my door just round the corner !
hurry up and connect to the mains
its certainly not millbrook shes visiting then , cowardly woman
seems sensible
do n't you know theresa may can be `` economical with the actualite ``
most disappointed she did n't come and visit our school to discuss the crippling budget cuts which are coming into force .
well staged managed only meet fellow tory voters who wo n't ask any questions just smile for camera ! ! !
and action ! ! !
kim jong may sneaks in to affluent street for pretend canvas
what 's she scared of this time , being asked some non pre-scripted questions ?
thats cos shes shit

documents.title: mystery death not treated as sus
text: the `` unexplained '' death of a man found with serious head injuries is no longer being treated as sus police have said .
a 55-year-old was found unconscious at a property in prince of wales avenue , reading , on sunday .
he died on tuesday .
thames valley police appealed to trace a female witness , who has since been located .
a post-mortem examination was inconclusive , and officers will continue to probe the cause of death .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South

documents.title: mol triumph on southampton water
text: we 're on board the giant cargo ship mol triumph as she heads up southampton water .
author: Neil Sackley
Reporter, BBC Radio Solent

documents.title: cyclist fell from bike before fatal crash
text: cyclist fell from bike before fatal crash

documents.title: southampton 0-2 arsenal : claude puel frustrated with lack of goals
text: southampton manager claude puel says he is frustrated with his side 's lack of goals after a 2-0 home defeat by arsenal .
second-half goals from alexis sanchez and olivier giroud earned victory for arsenal , keeping their hopes for a top four finish alive .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: dredd tv show : 'telling good story is key '
text: judge dredd 's publisher has set up its own production company as it develops a tv series for its most iconic character .
rebellion ceo jason kingsley said it would be behind the casting and production of the show , which could be filmed near its oxford base .
`` the only real issue for me is making sure we get a good story , '' he added .
author: Jeremy Stern
BBC South Today

documents.title: more from on board mol triumph
text: the giant cargo carrier mol triumph is now approaching southampton water as it makes its way into port .
author: Neil Sackley
Reporter, BBC Radio Solent

documents.title: defective taxis stopped in reading
text: council and police spot checks have found 13 hackney carriages and private hire taxis with defects on a single day .
nearly half of the vehicles stopped failed to comply with the terms of their licences , which included issues with bodywork , poor maintenance and not displaying the required licences .

reading town council 's paul gittings said : `` regular spot checks , like this one , allow us to continue to work closely with operators to ensure that vehicles are maintained to the high standard that we expect in reading . ''

documents.title: cyclist fell from bike before fatal crash
text: a cyclist who died in oxford after a crash involving a double-decker bus fell off her bike prior to the collision , according to police .
the 31-year-old woman , named locally as claudia comberti , was killed after the crash on the botley road on tuesday at 14:35 bst .
police said they were keeping the cyclist 's family up-to-date .
on wednesday more than 100 cyclists took part in a ride to commemorate the dphil student .

text: man held over father-of-four 's murder

documents.title: on board mol triumph
text: the ultra-large cargo carrier can hold the equivalent of 20,170 containers .
despite being such a huge ship , only about 20 crew members are needed to operate it .
we 're currently heading into the port of southampton .
author: Neil Sackley
Reporter, BBC Radio Solent

documents.title: mol triumph off isle of wight
text: this is the view from the pilot vessel meeting mol triumph off the isle of wight , ahead of being escorted into southampton .
when it arrives in southampton , the ultra-large cargo carrier will be the biggest ship ever to dock at a uk port .
author: Neil Sackley
Reporter, BBC Radio Solent

documents.title: breakingmurder arrest after southampton alleged assault victim dies
text: a 25-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder after a man died in hospital following an alleged assault in southampton .
jason gregory suffered a cardiac arrest in the incident which happened in vernon walk on 5 may between 23:45 and 00:45 bst .
the 44-year-old father of four has since died in hospital .
hampshire constabulary is appealing for anyone with phone footage of the incident to come forward .
author: Indy Almroth-Wright
BBC South

documents.title: ultra-large mol triumph container ship bound for southampton
text: the mol triumph ultra-large cargo ship is currently off the isle of wight as it heads towards southampton .
the 400m-long vessel will be be the biggest ship ever to dock in the uk - it can hold the equivalent of 20,170 containers .
built by samsung in south korea , the ship will run between chinese and european ports .
its operators claim it is more fuel efficient than previous carriers .
it is due in southampton port by 14:00 bst .

documents.title: `` do n't be fobbed off '' says the dorset woman with an inoperable brain tumour
text: a woman who was diagnosed with an inoprable brain tumour is telling people not to get `` fobbed off '' by the nhs .
amy quin was told she would have to wait 13 weeks to see a neurologist on the national health , before she resorted to private healthcare to get her diagnosis .
the 33 year old from piddletrenthide claims that the wait could have been fatal .

documents.title: sub-editing hub to close in weymouth , putting 18 jobs at risk
text: a local newspaper publishing house is due to close in weymouth , putting 18 jobs at risk .
newsquest , which publishes papers such as the dorset echo , will close its sub-editing hub in the dorset town .
according to hold the front page , staff have been sent a memo saying that copy-editing of newsquest titles will cease in weymouth by june .
the publishing company , which is responsible for more than 200 papers across the uk , closed its other sub-editing hub in newport in march .

documents.title: portsmouth recycling centre fire put out
text: a recycling centre fire has been put out after around 30 firefighters tackled the blaze .
hampshire fire and rescue service were called to the veolia recycling centre in portsmouth , where around 30 friefighters tackled the blaze .
about seven tonnes of green waste was alight , but the fire was brought under control and fire crews stopped the blaze at 07:14 .
# bellsdown : recycling fire in # portsmouth now out .
crews are still there dampening down .
for information here :

documents.title: reading manager jaap stam fears losing best players if promotion bid fails
text: reading manager jaap stam fears losing some of his best players should they miss out on promotion to the premier league through the play-offs .
stam led the royals to third place in his first season in charge and they now face a play-off meeting with fulham .
the dutchman believes the championship will be a stronger division next season with some big-spending clubs .
`` if you want to make steps yourself as a club , you do n't want to sell your best players , '' he said .

documents.title: oxford headlines : cyclists in tearful goodbye to claudia
text: today 's front page - tearful goodbye to claudia as friends congregate to hold cycle vigil

documents.title: aldershot runners ' deaths : no review of michael casey 's jail term
text: the sentence handed to a soldier who was over the alcohol limit and speeding when he killed two teenage athletes will not be reviewed , it has emerged .
stacey burrows , 16 , and lucy pygott , 17 , were killed while on a training run in aldershot , hampshire , on 8 november .
michael casey was sentenced to six years in april - he admitted causing their deaths by dangerous driving .
the attorney general 's office said the sentence would not be referred to the court of appeal .
explaining his decision , solicitor general robert buckland said he `` did not believe the sentence would be increased because it was in line with sentencing guidelines '' .

documents.title: jack phipps inquest : family 'upset ' by verdict
text: the family of a man thought to have died as a result of a violent assault say they are upset that a coroner attributed it to a medical condition .
jack phipps , 53 , was admitted to hospital on 22 june after collapsing in harefields in north oxford .
he died on 1 july .
police launched a murder investigation and a man was arrested but not charged .
niece hazel carter said : `` we 're feeling very disappointed , very upset , that justice has n't been served . ''
oxford coroner 's court heard the police investigation was halted because of a lack of evidence .
author: Dave Gilyeat
BBC South

documents.title: noel edmonds seeks £ 50m damages for hbos fraud
text: noel edmonds is seeking half of a £ 100m compensation pot that lloyds banking group has set aside for victims of a major hbos fraud .
the deal or no deal host claimed he has suffered `` deep distress and public humiliation '' because of the scandal .
he alleges that mark dobson , a hbos manager who was jailed , helped destroy his business called unique group .
mr edmonds 's lawyers have written to antonio horta-osorio , chief executive of hbos owner lloyds , seeking payment .
two former employees at hbos 's reading office were part of a £ 245m loans scam that cheated small business customers by insisting that they use a specific turnaround firm .

documents.title: fire crews battle portsmouth recycling plant blaze
text: around 30 firefighters are fighting blaze at a recycling centre in quartermaine road , portsmouth .
hampshire fire and rescue service said about seven tonnes of green waste was alight .
we 're in attendance at a recycling plant fire in # portsmouth .
if you travel to work or school via # quartremaineroad please avoid the area

documents.title: today 's weather : sunshine and showers
text: we 've got a mixture of sunshine and showers , but where we keep the sun it 's going to be rather warm .
there will be highs of 22c , and showers will continue tonight with temperatures during the evening going down to 9c .

documents.title: welcome to the beautiful south
text: good morning one and all and welcome to the beautiful south live page where - like paul heaton - we 're good as gold and stupid as mud , but carry on regardless .
and in the style of the beautiful south ( who were actually from the north ) we 'll be offering you our own eclectic variety of news , sports and weather from across the south region .
if you have any or stories from across the region do n't hesitate to send it to us on email .
above is a lovely sent by oxfordshire-based chris roberts , simply titled lunchtime in the cotswolds .
author: Alex Regan
BBC South
